1420571903819878400.name: Demforever
1420571903819878400.tweet: Glow in the dark. Tomopteris Plankton. This sea worm is the only organism capable of yellow bioluminescence. When disturbed, it releases a flurry of glowing sparks from its foot-like appendages that are called parapodia.  https://t.co/gjAhUm8Jrb

1414993894023077891.name: Dr Richard Kirby
1414993894023077891.tweet: Cuteness. A baby Tomopteris helgolandica in my plankton sample this week. Just 0.5 mm long now, it will grow to be a fast-swimming predatory worm in the plankton. Its light emitting organs are clearly visible at the tips of its parapodia 'limbs'. @zeiss_micro  https://t.co/D6gIO7YoRc
